register.description: The STATUS_PARAM register returns the LSE compile configuration parameters.

bitfield.description: Number of available input channel selection for loopback mode
Output Auto-Skip Enable
1D or 2D output addressing mode(2D if 1)
Core Output Channel Data Width
Source Line Inc by 2 Supported (if 1)
Source nibble offset address Supported (if 1)
H/VBLANK Insertion Supported (if 1)
Core_Input Pixel Matrix Height
Core Input Data Bus Width
Number of SL2 H3A Output Channels
Number of SL2 Output Channels
Number of Input Channels per thread
Number of VPORT input enabled
Number of threads supported

register.description: The STATUS_ERROR register returns the LSE error status.

bitfield.description: VBUSM I/F Last Write Error Status [14:11] Write Channel Number [10:8] VBUSM write error status
VBUSM I/F Last Read Error Status [4:3] Read Channel Number [2:0] VBUSM read error status

register.description: The STATUS_IDLE_MODE register returns IDLE status of LSE VBUSM port and in/output channels - 0: IDLE 1: ACTIVE

bitfield.description: Output Channel[9:0] Status
Input Channel[3:0] Status
SL2 vbusm I/F Write Port Status
SL2 vbusm I/F Read Port Status

register.description: The CFG_LSE register configures the LSE general hardware modes.

bitfield.description: Test mode Output Channel Signature Generation Enable 0: Disable (default) 1: Enable When enabled, LSE generates a unique CRC signature for each output channel's frame data at frame completion.
VBUSM Arbitration Fixed Mode select 0: Round-Robin Arbitration (default) 1: Fixed-mode Arbitration

Functional path (data to HWA core) enable during loopback mode 0: Disable 1: Enable When enabled, the loopback-enabled input channel is used also for CORE data input. Otherwise, it is strictly used for the loopback path.
LSE loopback mode enable 0: Disable 1: Enable When enabled, the second thread's input channel data (middle tap data) is looped back out to the last (#9) output channel.

register.description: The DST_COMMON_CFG register captures common configuration for the output channels

bitfield.description: output channel rounding offset value. Default value to be considered 6'h08

register.description: The PSA_SIGNATURE register returns the captured PSA signature value of the last frame data of output channel [a].

bitfield.description: 32-bit CRC signature value

register.description: The src0_cfg1 register configures the input channels for the processing thread [a]

bitfield.description: When set, skips SL2 reads from the channel and channel0 read_data is redirected to the current channel

Enables channel specific SRC_CFG and FRAME_SIZE parameters. 0 : Current channel config parameters are derived from chan0 MMR's. 1 : Current channel config parameters are derived from channel specific MMR's
Input Pixel Container Alignment 0: LSB-aligned 1: MSB-aligned
Input Pixel Container Size Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 16-bit 3: reserved Input pixel container size must be same or larger than input pixel width.
Input Pixel Width Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 14-bit 3: 16-bit The width defines the bit-depth of the pixel data to be extracted from the pixel container.

register.description: The src0_frame_size1 register configures the frame size of all input buffers for the processing thread [a].

bitfield.description: SL2 - Source Buffer Width (number of pixels)

register.description: The src1_cfg1 register configures the input channels for the processing thread [a]

bitfield.description: When set, skips SL2 reads from the channel and channel0 read_data is redirected to the current channel

Enables channel specific SRC_CFG and FRAME_SIZE parameters. 0 : Current channel config parameters are derived from chan0 MMR's. 1 : Current channel config parameters are derived from channel specific MMR's
Input Pixel Container Alignment 0: LSB-aligned 1: MSB-aligned
Input Pixel Container Size Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 16-bit 3: reserved Input pixel container size must be same or larger than input pixel width.
Input Pixel Width Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 14-bit 3: 16-bit The width defines the bit-depth of the pixel data to be extracted from the pixel container.

register.description: The src1_frame_size1 register configures the frame size of all input buffers for the processing thread [a].

bitfield.description: SL2 - Source Buffer Width (number of pixels)

register.description: The DBG register returns the current status of internal FSM - TI internal use only.

bitfield.description: Debug status

register.description: The SRC[a]_CFG register configures the input channels for the processing thread [a]

bitfield.description: Input kernel top padding lines valid=0..2 for msc
Input kernel bottom padding lines valid=0..2 for msc
Input kernel starting line position valid=0..4 for msc
Actual number of input kernel lines (height) valid=1..5 for msc
Source Line address Increment by 2 enable 0: Disable 1: Enable
Input Pixel Container Alignment 0: LSB-aligned 1: MSB-aligned
Input Pixel Container Size Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 16-bit 3: reserved Input pixel container size must be same or larger than input pixel width.
Input Pixel Width Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 14-bit 3: 16-bit The width defines the bit-depth of the pixel data to be extracted from the pixel container.

register.description: The SRC[a]_FRAME_SIZE register configures the frame size of all input buffers for the processing thread [a].

bitfield.description: SL2 - Source Buffer Height (number of lines)
SL2 - Source Buffer Width (number of pixels)

register.description: The SRC[a]_BUF_ATTR register configures the common attributes of all SL2 source buffers for the processing thread [a].

bitfield.description: Buffer Line start offset within the first SL2 data word - in half-byte (nibble) resolution
SL2 Circular Buffer Size (number of line buffers)
Buffer Stride Size [15:6] (64 byte multiple) stride size
Buffer Stride Size [5:0] - 6 LSB bits of buffer stride size should always be 0. Writes have no effect. Always read as 0

register.description: The SRC[a]_BUF_BA[b] register configures the base address of the SL2 source buffer [b] for the processing thread [a].

bitfield.description: Input Buffer Enable 0: Disable 1: Enable When the processing thread is enabled, at least one of the input buffer must be enabled
This bit when set, skips odd line processing
This bit when enabled skips processing of lines. This is used in YUV420 MSC scalar, processing Y and UV pixels on the single HTS thread
This bit when set, enable interleaved pixel extraction. usecases : YUV422 scenarios
This bit is valid when enable_interleaved_pixel_extraction is set. 1 : Odd pixels extracted 0 : Even pixels extracted
Base Address[23:6] - (64 Byte aligned) byte address
Base Address[5:0] - 6 LSB bits of address should always be 0. Writes have no effect. Always read as 0

register.description: The DST[a]_BUF_CFG register configures the output buffer channel [a].

bitfield.description: Channel Disable Status (read-only) 0: (Default) Chanel is enabled for Y, UV or YUV422 data transfer to SL2 memory. All configurations associated with this DST_BUF[a] are valid. 1: Channel is disabled for SL2 data transfer (because the channel logic is used internally for YUV data interleaving). All configuration associated with this DST_BUF[a] are ignored.
YUV422 Interleaving Order Selection 0: UYVY 1: YUYV Only Applicable if this output channel is YUV422 output capable LUMA channel. Otherwise, setting has no effect.

YUV422 Interleaved Output Merge Enable 0: Disable 1: Enable When enabled, this channel interleaves data from the associated chroma data output channel to output YUV422 interleaved data to the SL2 memory. Only Applicable if this output channel is YUV422 output capable LUMA channel. Otherwise, setting has no effect.
Specify the acclerator data to be signed or unsigned 0: Unsigned data (By default) 1: Signed Data
enable acclerator pixel output rounding 0: Disable rounding logic 1: Enable rounding logic
Output Channel - channel mapping per each thread 0: Mapped to channel-0 1: Mapped to channel-1
Output Channel - thread mapping 0: Mapped to Thread-0 1: Mapped to Thread-1
Output Pixel Container Alignment 0: LSB-aligned 1: MSB-aligned
Output Pixel Container Size Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: 16-bit 3: reserved Output pixel container size must be same or larger than output pixel width. If yuv422_out_en is set, pix_fmt_cntrsz must be 0.
Output Pixel Width Sel 0: 8-bit 1: 12-bit 2: reserved 3: 16-bit The width defines the bit-depth of the pixel data to be stored in the pixel container.

register.description: The DST[a]_BUF_ATTR0 register configures the attributes of the output SL2 buffer [a].

bitfield.description: SL2 Circular Buffer Size (number of line buffers)
Buffer Stride Size [15:6] (64 byte multiple) stride size
Buffer Stride Size [5:0] - 6 LSB bits of buffer stride size should always be 0. Writes have no effect. Always read as 0

register.description: The DST[a]_BUF_BA register configures the base address of the output SL2 circular buffer [a].

bitfield.description: Output Channel Enable 0: Disable 1: Enable
This bit when set, skips odd line processing
This bit when enabled skips processing of lines. This is used in YUV420 MSC scalar, processing Y and UV pixels on the single HTS thread
Base Address[23:6] - (64 Byte aligned) byte address
Base Address[5:0] - 6 LSB bits of address should always be 0. Writes have no effect. Always read as 0
